title: In The Drops: Rapha Pro Team jersey, Udog Distanza gravel shoes, Muc-Off Helmet Care kit, the ’23 Million Miles’ challenge and dogs
content:
Cyclist
In The Drops: Rapha Pro Team jersey, Udog Distanza gravel shoes, Muc-Off Helmet Care kit, the ’23 Million Miles’ challenge and dogs

Happy Friday, everyone. While there’s plenty happening in the outside world, there has only been one important thing on the cycling calendar this week: the Tour de France Femmes.

We’ve covered everything from the 10 British riders in this year’s Tour to in-depth features on pro bikes from the likes of Annemiek van Vleuten and Audrey Cordon-Ragot.

We also took a look at the closing stages of the men’s Tour de France, with a round-up our favourite race photos and we covered Thibaut Pinot bidding adieu to the iconic event in his final year as a pro.

Emma Cole chatted to Transcontinental Race rider Marin de Saint-Exupéry, who is getting ready to do tackle the ultra-race for the fifth time, and we had a look at what dotwatching is and why it’s so addictive.

Over on the tech front, we’ve brought you some stonking guides this week such as 11 essentials you should take on every bike ride and the best way to clean your bike helmet, as well as showcasing our favourite women’s bib shorts and an explainer on everything you need to know about Campagnolo road and gravel groupsets.

There are still two stages of the Tour de France Femmes left and the final individual time-trial stage in Pau promises an exciting end to the race’s second edition, so make sure you’re watching this weekend!

Rapha Pro Team Lightweight Jersey

The new Rapha Pro Team jersey is designed for riding in the hottest conditions and for that peak season racing. While we may not be blessed with blistering temperatures in the UK at the moment, we’re bound to get another dose of heat before the summer’s out and the Pro Team jersey will be ready for action.

The jersey is made from ultralight fabric and has a high stretch construction which Rapha says helps keep you cool and comfortable. There are four colours – I opted for an olive green as shown here – and there is a raised collar to protect your neck from the elements.

  • Buy now from Rapha (£150)

Udog Distanza gravel shoes

The Distanza gravel shoes are Udog’s first foray into off-road footwear. The shoes feature the Tension Wrap System (TWS) which uses TPU-laminated straps to wrap under and hug the rider’s foot when the upper laces are fully fastened. Udog says this helps promote efficient pedalling, as the foot is supported on both the up- and down-stroke.

The Distanzas have an oversize rubber outsole which runs the full length of the shoe and comes up and over the front to act as a toe bumper. The upper is made from a 3D engineered lightweight mesh, which Udog says is both breathable and highly durable.

The shoes are available in two models and the top-tier offering, shown here, features a carbon-reinforced sole.

  • Buy now from Udog (£220)

Muc-Off Helmet Care Kit

This week we did an entire guide on how to clean your bike helmet and, while warm soapy water can do just fine, it’s nice to have a dedicated kit that comes with all the essentials. Muc-Off’s helmet care kit is 4-in-1 and has a Foam Fresh cleaner, antifog lens/visor treatment, a lens-specific cleaner as well as two cleaning cloths.

The aim of the kit is to clean and protect, helping keep your bike helmet clean and your sunglasses fog free for riding in all conditions.

  • Buy now from Muc-Off (£30)

World Bicycle Relief ’23 Million Miles’ challenge

The world cycling championships in Glasgow are fast approaching and, to highlight its work, the event’s charity partner, World Bicycle Relief (WBR), has launched its latest challenge. ’23 Million Miles’ offers riders the chance to virtually contribute the miles they ride to the 23-million-mile target and fundraise for WBR and UK-based charity, Maggie’s, that provides support to those living with cancer.

There are a host of prizes available for participants as well, including tickets to world championship events, signed jerseys and Wahoo bike computers, so get involved while you can – the event ends on the final day of the world champs, 13th August.

  • For more information, go to UCI Cycling Worlds Championships

Deal of the week: Dhb Aeron Lab Carbon road shoes

The Dhb Aeron shoes are set of high quality performance road shoes – we even gave them 4.5 stars when we reviewed them. The shoes have 3K carbon soles, Atop dials and one piece aerodynamic uppers and are currently available at a 78% discount, now just £40.

  • Buy now from Wiggle (£40)

Ad feature

Ad feature ends

What we’re loving this week: Dogs (namely my dog)

I’m pretty sure most people love their pets – if you don’t, (a) you’re a grumpy old git or (b) they recently went through your bins and are in the doghouse (either figuratively or literally). My dog, Loki, however is clearly the best and here’s why:

  • He’s adorable – look at those eyes
  • He has recently learned to not run away whenever I take him off the lead and the pride I feel is what I imagine it’s like when parents watch their toddler walk for the first time
  • He’s adopted and has never once accused me of ‘not being his real mum’ – he’s only two, so maybe there’s still time for teenage tantrums
  • He forces me to go outside and embrace nature even when it’s pouring with rain. Sitting behind a desk all day isn’t great for the soul and if I don’t walk him, he’ll drive me bananas so it’s a win/win for everybody.

Maybe your dog can do lots of cool tricks or bark the alphabet but I’ll still say that mine is the best, even if I’m 99% sure he’s going through the bin as we speak.
